revised_title: Structural Study of Aqueous Nickel Chloride Solution
tldr: This study investigates the structure of a 4.35 molal solution of nickel chloride in heavy water using neutron diffraction and the method of multipattern analysis. The research focuses on the particle-particle pair correlation functions and extracts information about the arrangement of water molecules around the ions. The findings provide insights into the hydration of the nickel ions and the coordination of water molecules in the solution.
